documentation.text:
@dev Management of Operators.
 The Operator role is to execute the actions required when
 payments arrive to this contract, and then either
 confirm the success of those actions, or confirm the failure.
 The constructor sets a defaultOperator = deployer.
 The owner of the contract can change the defaultOperator.
 The owner of the contract can assign explicit operators to each universe.
 If a universe does not have an explicitly assigned operator,
 the default operator is used.

@dev Management of Operators.
 The Operator role is to execute the actions required when
 payments arrive to this contract, and then either
 confirm the success of those actions, or confirm the failure.
 The constructor sets a defaultOperator = deployer.
 The owner of the contract can change the defaultOperator.
 The owner of the contract can assign explicit operators to each universe.
 If a universe does not have an explicitly assigned operator,
 the default operator is used.

devdoc.details: Management of Operators. The Operator role is to execute the actions required when payments arrive to this contract, and then either confirm the success of those actions, or confirm the failure. The constructor sets a defaultOperator = deployer. The owner of the contract can change the defaultOperator. The owner of the contract can assign explicit operators to each universe. If a universe does not have an explicitly assigned operator, the default operator is used.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
